intro: Pearcea glabrata, commonly known as the smooth pearcea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Pearcea glabrata typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
